title: Job Openings at VEIN
content:
VEIN is Lagos’ new heartbeat for premium nightlife — a space where great music, creative energy, and impeccable service come together. We deliver an elevated club experience driven by ambiance, talent, and world-class hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Intelligence Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary
     

            
    




	The Intelligence Officer will be responsible for monitoring internal activity, preventing security breaches, identifying risks early, and proactively gathering information to protect the business, our guests, and our staff.
	This role requires strong observation skills, emotional intelligence, analytical thinking, and the ability to operate quietly and professionally in a nightlife setting.


Key Responsibilities
Operational & Security Intelligence:


	Observe daily floor operations discreetly and report inconsistencies, misconduct, or suspicious behavior.
	Monitor guest and staff interactions to identify risks, threats, potential breaches, or unusual activity.
	Identify internal theft, collusion, or policy violations and escalate appropriately.
	Stay alert to emerging trends, customer patterns, and potential threats to the business.


Compliance & Reporting:


	Ensure departmental SOPs, security policies, and service standards are followed in real time.
	Conduct routine assessments on staff performance, guest flow, and operational vulnerabilities.
	Prepare daily intelligence reports highlighting observations, risks, and recommendations.
	Maintain strict confidentiality and chain-of-command protocols.


Incident Prevention & Response:


	Proactively detect conflict, crowd dynamics, or suspicious behavior before escalation.
	Support security team during emergencies, high-risk scenarios, and VIP events.
	Monitor sensitive operational processes (cash handling, entry screening, VIP access, restricted areas).


Collaborative Support:


	Work closely with Security, Operations, and Guest Experience teams.
	Provide intelligence briefings to management when required.
	Reinforce a culture of professionalism, awareness, loyalty, and discipline across departments.


Requirements


	Previous experience in security, intelligence, surveillance, operations monitoring, or similar role (hospitality/nightlife experience preferred).
	Strong situational awareness and emotional intelligence.
	Excellent observation skills and ability to detect behavioral cues and inconsistencies.
	Demonstrated confidentiality and loyalty in previous roles.
	Ability to remain calm, neutral, and professional under pressure and in high-energy environments.
	Smart, well-spoken, mature, and confident with strong analytical and reporting skills.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including late nights, weekends, and peak periods.


Personal Attributes:


	Discreet and trustworthy
	Alert, proactive, and quick-thinking
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	High sense of integrity and responsibility
	Problem-solver and critical thinker
	Physically presentable and composed


Salary
N150,000 - N170,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@folixxhospitality.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Human Resources Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Luxury Nightlife & Hospitality

About the Role


	We are looking for a proactive, people-focused, operations-driven HR Manager who can maintain our elite service culture, manage a diverse workforce, and drive top-tier HR standards that match our brand.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment & Talent Management:


	End-to-end hiring for all clubhouse units (cashiers, waitresses, stewards, security, bouncers, hygiene, bar staff, kitchen staff, hosts/hostesses, dancers, DJs, etc.).
	Conduct structured shortlisting, interviews, reference checks, and onboarding.
	Maintain a steady pipeline of high-quality talent to reduce downtime during peak operations.


Training, Culture & Development:


	Drive the club luxury service culture: grooming, presentation, behavior, and performance standards.
	Organize daily pre-shift briefings and periodic refresher trainings.
	Reinforce values: discipline, respect, speed, courtesy, and elite customer perception.


Employee Relations & Welfare:


	Act as the bridge between management and staff while maintaining confidentiality.
	Address conflicts professionally and resolve grievances timely.
	Maintain attendance systems, punctuality discipline, and documentation.
	Support welfare initiatives that improve morale and reduce turnover.


Performance & Discipline Management:


	Track KPIs and performance metrics across all units.
	Document infractions and enforce disciplinary procedures fairly.
	Handle warnings, suspensions, and terminations as required.
	Support managers in monitoring staff behavior on and off the floor.


HR Operations & Compliance:


	Maintain up-to-date employee files, contracts, appraisals, and onboarding records.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, labor laws, and safety guidelines.
	Prepare HR reports for management.


Operational Support During Club Hours:


	Visibility during operations to monitor staff conduct and uniform standards.
	Support security, cashiers, hosts, dancers, bar, and floor teams as needed.
	Ensure staff are positioned correctly and working efficiently.


Requirements


	BSc / HND in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	3–5+ years of HR experience (hospitality/nightlife experience is a strong advantage).
	Strong knowledge of recruitment, employee management, and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, documentation, and leadership skills.
	Ability to manage high-pressure, fast-paced nightlife operations.
	Strong emotional intelligence and conflict resolution skills.
	High level of discipline, confidentiality, and maturity.
	Must be able to work nights/weekends occasionally during operations.


Salary
N450,000 - N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@folixxhospitality.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Females are advised to strongly apply.

 

 

3.) Operations Manager (Nightlife & Club Operations)

Job Location: Victoria Island Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are looking to hire a female Operations Manager to oversee and elevate the daily operations of our club.
	This role requires someone who understands nightlife culture, thrives in social environments, and can manage people and experiences effortlessly.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily club operations and service delivery
	Ensure exceptional guest experience at all times
	Manage floor staff and operational teams effectively
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key guests and industry stakeholders
	Support management in driving standards, structure, and growth


Key Requirements


	Strong exposure to the nightlife industry (minimum 2 years’ experience)
	Naturally polished, well-presented, and confident, with a strong personal aura
	Excellent socialising and networking skills
	Well connected and affluent within the nightlife and entertainment scene
	Highly customer-centric, with strong customer relationship skills
	Proven people management and leadership ability
	Calm, intelligent, and able to think clearly under pressure
	Well spoken, articulate, and emotionally intelligent
	Ability to represent the brand confidently with guests, partners, and high-profile clientele
	Female candidates are strongly advised to apply.


Ideal Candidate:


	You are someone who understands nightlife beyond parties — you understand people, energy, service, and image.
	You command respect naturally and know how to balance authority with warmth.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and recent photograph to: hr@folixxhospitality.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Laundry Officer & Laundry Attendant

Job Location: Ikate, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Hospitality (Clubhouse)

About the Role


	We are hiring Laundry Attendants to support daily laundry operations.
	You will be responsible for washing, drying, ironing, sorting, and packaging uniforms, towels, linens, and fabric materials.
	The ideal candidate is reliable, hardworking, and detail-focused.


Responsibilities


	Wash, dry, iron, and fold clothes, towels, linens, uniforms, and other materials.
	Treat stains with appropriate chemicals and methods.
	Sort laundry based on fabric type, colour, and cleaning instructions.
	Assist in the operation of washing machines, dryers and pressing equipment.
	Keep the laundry area clean, organized, and compliant with hygiene standards.
	Ensure timely delivery of clean items to respective units.
	Report damaged items or equipment faults immediately.
	Follow all safety and fabric-care procedures.


Requirements


	Minimum of an SSCE
	1 – 2 years of experience in laundry, cleaning, or housekeeping (preferred but not mandatory).
	Basic knowledge of washing, ironing, and stain removal.
	Physically fit and able to lift moderate loads.
	Reliable, disciplined, and attentive to detail.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@veinlagos.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	The Executive Assistant to the CEO will provide high-level administrative, operational, and strategic support to ensure the CEO’s office runs efficiently.

Key Responsibilities:
Administrative Support:


	Manage the CEO’s calendar, meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

	Maintain and update confidential files, records, and databases.
